New Records: Detroit Pistons reached.500 for the first time after New Year's Day since 2019
Key Match Events: Cade Cunningham had 32 points and nine assists
Tim Hardaway Jr. added 26 points for Detroit
Jalen Duren had 14 points and 12 rebounds
Anfernee Simons had 36 points and nine assists for Portland
Shaedon Sharpe had 20 points, eight assists and eight rebounds
Malik Beasley hit a 3-pointer to put the Pistons ahead 114-110
Deandre Ayton dunked for Portland with 49.5 seconds to go, but Duren's putback restored the four-point lead
Pre-Game Insights: Coach Chauncey Billups was honored before the game for his contributions to Detroit's 2004 championship and his induction into the Basketball Hall of Fame
Post-Match Reflections: Detroit hasn't been.500 after New Year's since it finished 41-41 in 2018-19
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Blazers nearly blew Detroit off the floor in the first three minutes of the second quarter
Portland outshot Detroit 53.3% to 44.7% from the floor, but went 3 of 5 from the free-throw line while Detroit was 19 of 22
The Pistons also had a 17-7 edge in offensive rebounds
Others: The Pistons (18-18), who were 3-33 after 36 games a season ago, have won seven of eight
